intro: Tagetes epapposa, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or zucchini flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers and is part of the Asteraceae family. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and has feathery, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often used in ornamental gardening. Its flowers are also used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
